result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricky Maldonado

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ricky Maldonado appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appeared by video for Ricky Maldonado.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  Parties remain in trial posture.  Any further motions will be heard on day of trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 11/7/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.

Case heard off the record.  Defense counsel's motion to adjourn final pretrial granted.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Received and Filed. State's Motion to Join Case

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Ricky Maldonado not in court, in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed a week before the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35
Defendant Ricky Maldonado in court, appear by video with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont, appear by video.  Defendant Ricky Maldonado in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 35, Judge Rosa. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ricky Maldonado not in court, defendant in custody. Attorney Sargent appear on behalf of Mary Garvin Guimont.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness present. Defence needs more time to meet with client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ricky Maldonado in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Ricky Maldonado in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ricky Maldonado appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Branch 35. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with EJD and EM (05/24/2021); Ellianna M.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
